section.title: Environment
section.para: To use Pegasus, you need ot have the pegasus-* tools in your PATH. If you have installed Pegasus from RPM/DEB packages. the tools will be in the default PATH, in /usr/bin. If you have installed Pegasus from binary tarballs or source, add the bin/ directory to your PATH.

note.para: Pegasus 4.0 is different from previous versions of Pegasus in that it does not require PEGASUS_HOME to be set or sourcing of any environtment setup scripts.

section.para: If you want to use the DAX APIs, you might also need to set your PYTHONPATH, PERLLIB, or CLASSPATH. The right setting can be found by using pegasus-config:
section.programlisting: # export PYTHONPATH=`pegasus-config --python` # export PERLLIB=`pegasus-config --perl` # export CLASSPATH=`pegasus-config --classpath`

section.title: Native Packages (RPM/DEB)
section.para: The preferred way to install Pegasus is with native (RPM/DEB) packages. It is recommended that you also install Condor (yum, debian) from native packages.

section.title: RHEL / CentOS / Scientific Linux
section.para: Add the Pegasus repository to yum downloading the Pegasus repos file and adding it to /etc/yum.repos.d/. For RHEL 5 based systemes:
section.programlisting:
# yum search pegasus pegasus.x86_64 : Workflow management system for Condor, grids, and clouds # yum install pegasus Running Transaction Installing : pegasus
Installed: pegasus :4.0.0-1
Complete!

section.title: Debian

section.title: Pegasus from Tarballs
section.para: The Pegaus prebuild tarballs can be downloaded from the Pegasus Download Page.

section.title: Tarball without Condor
section.para: Use these tarballs if you already have Condor installed or prefer to keep the Condor installation separate from the Pegasus installation.

listitem.para: include the Pegasus bin directory in your PATH

section.title: Tarball with Included Condor
section.para: For convenience, there is Pegasus WMS tarballs which has Condor included. This way you can install Pegasus and Condor at the same time, with just minor configuration to get up and running.

listitem.para: Edit the Condor Configuration file. The configuration file is currently configured to run only as a submit side (Runs schedd) supporting schedule, local and grid universe. If you want to use it for gt4, lsf, pbs or condor-c additional configuration changes may be required. Please check the Condor Manual for appropriate parameters.

2 parameters need to change at this point. Change !!PEGASUS_HOME!! to the actual path where PEGASUS_WMS is installed and CHANGE !!USER!! to the user who will receive email in case of error. (This can be just your username )

para.programlisting:
# vim $PEGASUS_HOME/etc/condor_config
RELEASE_DIR = !!PEGASUS_HOME!! # CHANGE THIS TO PATH OF PEGASUS_WMS INSTALLATION WILL GET EMAIL IN CASE OF ERROR.
